# igplot

<!-- badges: start -->
[![R-CMD-check](https://github.com/baruuum/igplot/workflows/R-CMD-check/badge.svg)](https://github.com/baruuum/igplot/actions)
<!-- badges: end -->

This is just a simple wraper around the `base::plot` function to create network plots faster than `igraph`.

## Installation

You can install `igplot` with:

``` r
remotes::install_github("baruuum/igplot")
```

## Usage

```{r example, out.width = "50%", fig.align = "center"}
library(igplot)

# make graph
set.seed(123)
g = igraph::erdos.renyi.game(10, .35)

# make plot with igraph package
set.seed(42)
tictoc::tic()
plot(g, layout = igraph::layout_with_fr)
tictoc::toc()
```

```{r out.width = "30%", fig.align = "center"}
# make same plot with igplot
set.seed(42)
tictoc::tic()
igplot(
    g, 
    layout = "layout_with_fr", 
    plot_opts = list(
        v_cex = 2, 
        e_lwd = .8
    )
)
tictoc::toc()
```

`igplot` should be faster than `plot.igraph` especially for larger graphs:

```{r fig.show = "hide", cache = TRUE}
g = erdos.renyi.game(5000, .05)
tictoc::tic()
pdf("images/plot1.pdf", width = 6, height = 5)
plot(g, layout = layout_with_fr)
dev.off()
tictoc::toc()

tictoc::tic()
igplot(
    g, 
    layout = "layout_with_fr", 
    bg = "white", 
    outfile = "images/plot2.pdf",
    width = 6,
    height = 5,
    return_dat = FALSE
)
tictoc::toc()
```

See vignette for more examples.
